intro: Pollichia amplexicaulis, commonly known as the clasping polly, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Onagraceae family, which includes other familiar plants like willowherbs and evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. Its leaves are opposite and often clasping the stem, giving it its common name. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
